DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Cerebrovascular Accident Or Thromboembolism Personal Medical History Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator for whether or not patient has history of cerebrovascular accident or thromboembolism.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Cerebrovascular Accident Or Thromboembolism Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Cerebrovascular Accident Or Thromboembolism Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of recent (<= 90 days) thromboembolic or cerebrovascular event such as transient ischemic attack, cerebrovascular accident, or hemodynamically significant (massive or sub-massive) deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary emboli? Exceptions include: Patients with DVT/PE that do not result in hemodynamic instability as long as they are anticoagulated for at least 4 weeks, and patients with DVT/PE related to indwelling catheter or other procedures
